intro: Rhynchodium sericeum, commonly known as the silky rhynchodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine, silky hairs. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
